page.h2: Titles listed at the State Library of New South Wales

ul.li: George Bouchier Worgan - Letter to Richard Worgan, 20 January 1788 - 11 July 1788 (c830/a1175)
John Easty - `Pt Jno Easty A Memorandum of the Transa.. of a Vy Voiage from England to Botany Bay in The Scarborough...' (dl_spencer374/a1145)
James Scott / Remark on a passage Botnay [sic] bay 1787 (ms_q43/a1142)

A Journal of a Voyage from Portsmouth to New South Wales and China in the Lady Penrhyn, Merchantman William Cropton Sever, Commander by Arthur Bowes, Smyth, Surgeon - 1787-1788 - 1789 (safe1_15/a1085)
Arthur Bowes Smyth - drawings from his journal (safe1_15/a604)
Ralph Clark - journal kept on the Friendship during a voyage to Botany Bay and Norfolk Island ... (safe1_27/a262)
Jacob Nagle his Book A.D. One Thousand Eight Hundred and Twenty Nine May 19th. Canton. Stark County Ohio', 1775-1802, compiled 1829 (mss5954/a366)
Phillip Parker King - album of drawings and engravings, 1802-1829 (pxc767/a1084)
William Bradley journal : A Voyage to New South Wales, December 1786 - May 1792 (safe1_14/a138)
William Bradley - drawings from the First Fleet journal titled `A Voyage to New South Wales (safe1_14/a157)
William Bradley - charts from the First Fleet journal titled 'A Voyage to New South Wales', December 1786 - May 1792 (safe1_14/a158)
William Bradley - maps from the First Fleet journal titled 'A Voyage to New South Wales', December 1786 - May 1792 (safe1_14/a160)
William Waterhouse - papers, 1782-1803 ( letters received by William Waterhouse from his son Henry Waterhouse) (mss6544/a603)
David Blackburn - papers relating to his service in New South Wales, 1788-1792 (mss6937/a591)
David Blackburn - letters received (2) from his sister Margaret Blackburn, 1785 & 1789 (mss6937/a590)
Margaret Blackburn - letters received (14) from her brother David Blackburn, 1787-1791 (mss6937/a588)
David Blackburn - letters received by Richard Knight, 12 July 1788, 19 March 1791 (safe1_120/a587)
Blackburn family - miscellaneous papers, being mainly correspondence relating to David Blackburn's death, 1779-1796 (mss6937/a592)
